definition: To have enough money, time, or ability for something; to provide or supply.
examples: We can’t afford a new laptop this term.
The window affords a view of the meadow.

extra.memory_tip: Afford = can ‘offer’ the cost or time.

definition: To talk with too much pride; a statement of pride.
examples: He boasted about his high score. (verb)
Her cooking is the village’s greatest boast. (noun)

definition: Three or more musical notes played together; a line segment joining two points on a curve.
examples: She learned a new guitar chord.
A chord cuts across the circle.

extra.memory_tip: Chord with an ‘h’ is for harmony (not a ‘cord’).

definition: Unusually good; much better than average; rare.
examples: She has exceptional talent in maths.
It was an exceptional year for harvests.

extra.memory_tip: Exceptional = the exception to the usual.

definition: The outer edge of something; less central; to border or edge.
examples: Flowers grew on the fringe of the wood. (noun)
A lake fringed the town. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Fringe = the fuzzy edge of things.

definition: Modest; not proud; of low rank; to lower someone’s pride.
examples: Despite winning, she stayed humble. (adjective)
The defeat humbled the champions. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Humble = keep your head low, not your heart.

definition: A field of grass and wildflowers, often used for hay.
examples: Bees buzzed across the sunny meadow.
Cows grazed in the lower meadow.

definition: A gentle, lasting sadness; sadly thoughtful.
examples: A touch of melancholy filled the old song. (noun)
She wore a melancholy smile. (adjective)

definition: Refusing to change your mind or behaviour; stubborn.
examples: He was obstinate about the rules.
An obstinate stain wouldn’t wash out.

definition: To ask earnestly; to state in court whether one is guilty or not; to argue for.
examples: She pleaded for a second chance.
The defendant pleaded not guilty.

extra.memory_tip: Plead = pour feelings into your plea.

definition: To move or fall suddenly and quickly; a sudden dive or fall.
examples: They plunged into the cold lake. (verb)
With a brave plunge, he jumped in. (noun)

extra.memory_tip: Plunge = a bold drop or dive.

definition: To become less severe or strict; to give in.
examples: At last the storm relented.
The teacher relented and granted extra time.

definition: To hand in or present; to accept another’s authority.
examples: Please submit your assignment online.
They refused to submit to threats.

extra.memory_tip: Submit = send under (sub) for review or control.

definition: To walk slowly and with heavy steps; a long, tiring walk.
examples: We trudged home through the snow. (verb)
After a long trudge, they reached the hut. (noun)

definition: Lucky; having good results by chance; favourable.
examples: We were fortunate with the weather.
She felt fortunate to have such friends.
